meanings.sent1: I will oblige my friend by helping him with his homework.
meanings.sent2: She always obliges her neighbors by watering their plants when they are away.
meanings.sent3: The kind neighbor obliged the old lady by carrying her heavy groceries.
meanings.sent4: The teacher obliged the students by extending the deadline for the assignment.
meanings.sent5: He obliged his sister by fixing her broken bicycle.

meanings.definition: To compel by moral, legal, or physical means
meanings.sent1: The law obliges everyone to wear a seatbelt while driving.
meanings.sent2: The contract obliges the company to deliver the goods on time.
meanings.sent3: The doctor obliged the patient to take the prescribed medication for a speedy recovery.
meanings.sent4: The rules oblige us to follow safety protocols in the laboratory.
meanings.sent5: The oath of loyalty obliges soldiers to protect their country.

meanings.sent1: I feel obliged to thank you for your kind words.
meanings.sent2: She was obliged for the help she received during a difficult time.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to oblige after being given a treat.
meanings.sent4: The student felt obliged to the teacher for the extra help before the exam.
meanings.sent5: He was obliged to his parents for their unwavering support.
